title: For Loops
description: Learn to use for loops for counting and iteration

content.introduction:
When you know exactly how many times you want to repeat something, the `for` loop is the perfect tool. It's more concise and readable than a while loop for counting operations.

In this lesson, you'll learn how to use for loops to iterate over ranges of values efficiently.

### What You'll Learn
- Basic for loop syntax (for...to)
- Counting backwards (for...downto)
- Using the loop variable
- Nested for loops
- When to use for vs while

concepts.title: For-To Loop
concepts.description: Counts upward from start to end: for variable := start to end do statement

concepts.title: For-Downto Loop
concepts.description: Counts downward from start to end: for variable := start downto end do statement

concepts.title: Loop Variable
concepts.description: The counter variable is automatically updated; you don't manually increment it

concepts.title: Loop Scope
concepts.description: The loop variable should be declared before the loop and is read-only inside the loop

exercises.title: Even Numbers
exercises.description: Write a program that displays all even numbers from 2 to 20 using a for loop.
hints: You can loop from 1 to 10 and multiply by 2
Or loop from 2 to 20 by 2 (but DWScript for loops increment by 1)
Inside the loop, calculate the even number: i * 2
Alternative: loop 2 to 20, use if (i mod 2 = 0)

exercises.title: Factorial Calculator
exercises.description: Calculate the factorial of 6 (6! = 6 * 5 * 4 * 3 * 2 * 1) using a for loop.
hints: Multiply result by i in each iteration

exercises.title: FizzBuzz
exercises.description: Print numbers 1-15, but for multiples of 3 print 'Fizz', for multiples of 5 print 'Buzz', and for multiples of both print 'FizzBuzz'.
exercises.solution:
program FizzBuzz;

var
  i: Integer;

begin
  for i := 1 to 15 do
  begin
    if (i mod 15 = 0) then
      WriteLn('FizzBuzz')
    else if (i mod 3 = 0) then
      WriteLn('Fizz')
    else if (i mod 5 = 0) then
      WriteLn('Buzz')
    else
      WriteLn(i);
  end;
end.
hints: Check if divisible by both 3 AND 5 first (i mod 15 = 0)

exercises.title: Right-Aligned Triangle
exercises.description: Create a right-aligned triangle pattern with 5 rows. Row 1 has 4 spaces and 1 star, row 2 has 3 spaces and 2 stars, etc.
hints: Outer loop: for each row (1 to 5)
Don't forget WriteLn after each row

exercises.title: Sum of Squares
exercises.description: Calculate the sum of squares from 1² to 10² (1² + 2² + 3² + ... + 10²).
hints: In each iteration, add i * i to sum

content.summary:
Fantastic work! You've learned:

- **For-to loops**: Counting upward with for...to
- **For-downto loops**: Counting downward with for...downto
- **Automatic incrementing**: The loop variable updates automatically
- **Begin-end blocks**: Executing multiple statements per iteration
- **Nested loops**: Using for loops inside other for loops

For loops are perfect when you know exactly how many iterations you need!
content.nextSteps: Next, you'll learn about **repeat-until loops** - another type of loop that always executes at least once and checks the condition at the end!
